channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Acer Predator Helios 16S AI Review: Great Performance, Annoying Crashes
item.description: This Acer laptop’s top-tier performance is undone by bottom-shelf stability.

item.title: UN Plastics Treaty Talks Once Again End in Failure
item.description: Procedural hurdles yet again foil progress on a global agreement to end plastic pollution.

item.title: Judge says FTC investigation into Media Matters ‘should alarm all Americans’
item.description: A federal judge has blocked the FTC's investigation into Media Matters research around advertising and antisemitic content on X.

item.title: I Tried the Best At-Home Pet DNA Test Kits on My Two Cats (2025)
item.description: I sent my cats' saliva to the lab to get health and genetic insights sent to my inbox—with very different results.

item.title: DJI Osmo 360 Review: A Strong Start
item.description: DJI’s debut 360 camera is a strong challenger to the Insta360 X5. Too bad it’s not officially available in the US.

item.title: Winklevoss twins’ crypto company Gemini files for IPO
item.description: Another crypto company is headed for the public markets.

item.title: Anthropic says some Claude models can now end ‘harmful or abusive’ conversations
item.description: Anthropic says new capabilities allow its latest AI models to protect themselves by ending abusive conversations.

item.title: AI-powered stuffed animals are coming for your kids
item.description: Do A.I. chatbots packaged inside cute-looking plushies offer a viable alternative to screen time for kids? Maybe not.

item.title: 11 Best Android Phones of 2025, Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Shopping for a phone can be an ordeal. That’s why we’ve tested almost every Android phone, from the smartest to the cheapest—even phones that fold—to ...

item.title: Sam Altman, over bread rolls, explores life after GPT-5
item.description: At a dinner with reporters in San Francisco, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman spilled details on the company's ambitions beyond ChatGPT.
